item.title: Why Batman: Arkham Shadow Should Only Be the First of Many Batman VR Games
item.description:
Batman: Arkham Shadow is the latest entry in the beloved Arkham series, and while it is a VR game, that hasn't kept it from being a compelling chapter. It's understandable that many have wanted a fresh Arkham story available on consoles, but Batman: Arkham Shadow is still an incredibly strong continuation of the franchise's legacy.

Arkham Shadow is set six months after the events of Arkham Origins , following a less-experienced version of Batman as he tracks down the story's main villain, the Rat King. Batman has been the most successful hero in DC's gaming ventures by far. What makes Batman resonate with so many people is that he's a unique character in the main DC Comics roster. His status as a normal human who does not possess any actual superpowers ultimately makes him stand out. On top of that, Batman's more brooding and dark detective-inspired nature makes for compelling stories, which could make VR the perfect stage to continue telling these tales.

Batman's Role as DC's Detective Makes VR a Great Home for Future Arkham Stories

VR may not be every person's preferred way to experience a game, but Arkham Shadow showcases just how fun it can be to live out the role of Batman. The first-person perspective makes Arkham Shadow one of the most immersive chapters in the series yet, as it can feel like one is actually walking in Bruce Wayne's shoes as a vigilante. Sneaking through Gotham while trying to uncover the mysteries surrounding the Rat King would still be fun if it were a third-person console offering, but getting to experience everything up close and personal through the eyes of Batman can be even more effective.

Arkham Shadow 's first-person POV change was one of the biggest challenges developer Camouflaj had to face, but the studio managed to do so surprisingly well. From the game's combat to the more investigative moments in the story, Arkham Shadow is a great demonstration of how detective-focused action games work incredibly well in VR.

As of February 2025, Arkham Shadow has surpassed over one million players, marking a huge milestone for the VR title.

Rumors of Another Batman Game Raise Questions

According to Bloomberg's Jason Schreier, there may be a new Batman game developed by Rocksteady planned for the distant future. Of course, claims like this should be taken with a grain of salt until officially confirmed by developers, but if true, it will be interesting to see if Rocksteady takes note of Camouflaj's work with Arkham Shadow .

After Rocksteady's controversial Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League failed to bring a satisfying Arkhamverse story to life, the developer reportedly returning its focus to Batman is intriguing. On the other hand, though, Camouflaj may still be a strong studio to continue the Arkhamverse, at least in the VR space. A world where Rocksteady develops console-focused Arkham entries while Camouflaj focuses on VR spin-offs isn't outside the realm of possibility.

Even if Rocksteady comes back with a strong Arkham game, the VR entries hopefully won't stop. Arkham Shadow brought a thrillingly deep level of immersion that may be hard to replicate again via console. Only time will tell, but an Arkham Shadow follow-up is hopefully in the cards.

Developer Monolith is also currently working on its Wonder Woman game, but it's unclear if it will be connected to the Arkhamverse.

The Future of the Arkhamverse is in a Tough Position Right Now

Warner Bros. and its gaming aspirations in general have had a rocky year, but Arkham Shadow was a rare silver lining. Whatever route the Arkhamverse takes, Camouflaj's work on Arkham Shadow will hopefully inspire the series going forward.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Players Want More Duos to Have Team-Ups
item.description:
Summary

  • Fans want more duo team-ups like Captain America and Winter Soldier in Marvel Rivals for enhanced gameplay.
  • The mid-season update on February 21 will introduce new heroes, a map, and balance changes to shake up the game's meta.
  • Players are excited for the addition of The Thing and Human Torch, speculating on unique team-up abilities for these new heroes.

Marvel Rivals players recently took to social media to express their interest in seeing NetEase Games add more duo team-ups between characters like Captain America and Winter Soldier in the popular hero shooter. Fans of Marvel Rivals have a lot to look forward to, as the title is about to drop a major mid-season update on February 21. The added content is set to debut two new heroes, a new map, and numerous balance changes that may alter the meta of the game.

Team-ups in Marvel Rivals encourage players to work together when composing a group, offering enhancements to gamers who choose to take advantage of the feature. Characters are often given passive bonuses along with an active ability. For instance, in the case of Magneto and Scarlet Witch, the heroine receives a passive buff to her damage, while Magneto gains the ability to wield a large metal sword against his foes.

In a recent post on Reddit, Omari_03 suggested that NetEase Games should add team-ups between several popular duos, including Captain America and Winter Soldier in Marvel Rivals . The two heroes have a longstanding relationship in both the comics and the MCU, with Bucky acting as Captain America's sidekick before he became Winter Soldier. The Redditor also suggested that Storm and Black Panther should have a team-up ability, as the two were married at one point in the comics and often fought together on the battlefield.

Marvel Rivals Players Suggest New Team-Ups

The post also pointed out that Magik and Doctor Strange may make for a useful duo, as the Sorcerer Supreme once acted as the mutant's mentor while she struggled to gain control over her abilities. Marvel Rivals ' Wolverine and Punisher also have a history of working both with and against each other in the comics, as they are both brutal characters with a tendency to kill their enemies. While there are no guarantees, NetEase Games has stated that it plans to add and remove team-ups periodically, which leaves the door open for these duos to become a reality.

Many gamers are looking forward to the addition of The Thing and Human Torch to Marvel Rivals , both of which will make their debut in the near future. In addition to playing the heroes themselves, a large portion of the community is curious to see what kind of team-ups they will add to the title. It's rumored that Human Torch will have a unique ability with Storm at launch, allowing the two characters to create fire tornadoes on the battlefield. Some players have already speculated that The Thing may have the ability to throw Wolverine into fights, similar to the mutant's team-up with Hulk. With so much content on the way and even more in the works, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Marvel Rivals .

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: Why You Should Start Over in 2025
item.description:
Larian Studios is preparing to release the final major patch for Baldur’s Gate 3 , and it brings more than just bug fixes. Patch 8 introduces 12 new subclasses, adding fresh gameplay options across every class in the game. For players looking to experiment with new builds, role-play different archetypes, or simply experience the game from a different angle, now is the perfect time to start over.

With cross-play finally arriving, multiplayer sessions are more accessible than ever. The Baldur’s Gate 3 update also includes a Photo Mode, allowing players to capture the best moments of their adventure. However, the real reason to return in 2025 lies in the sheer variety offered by the new subclasses, each providing unique abilities that shake up combat, exploration, and role-playing.

Related
What Do You Think of Custom Campaigns in Baldur's Gate 3?

The dedication of modders for BG3 has continued to surprise me. Ever since the game was released I had a small hope of one day being able to play additional chapters, custom campaigns, and add-on / DLC-like content. However, I had not expected to see such progress by early 2025. There are already several additional chapters, custom campaigns, and remakes in progress as mods for the game, and if any of them get to a point of completion I will be so ready to sink a concerning amount of hours into the game.

New Subclasses Reinvent Baldur’s Gate 3 Builds

Each of the 12 classes in Baldur’s Gate 3 is getting a new subclass, offering fresh playstyles that cater to different strategies and preferences. Some focus on crowd control, while others enhance role-playing opportunities or introduce new ways to approach combat.

The Bard’s College of Glamour emphasizes enchantment, allowing players to charm enemies and inspire allies in ways that reshape encounters. Meanwhile, the Barbarian’s Path of Giants makes strength-based characters even more imposing, granting them increased size and the ability to throw enemies with devastating force. The Fighter’s Arcane Archer blends ranged combat with magic, giving archers new ways to control the battlefield.

Other additions focus on utility and support. The Druid’s Circle of Stars introduces celestial forms that grant healing, damage buffs, and constitution bonuses. The Cleric’s Death Domain leans into necromantic power, with abilities that exploit enemy corpses for offensive spells. The Paladin’s Oath of the Crown shifts the class into a defensive role, offering group-wide protection and battlefield control.

Fresh Ways to Approach Role-Playing and Combat in BG3

Many of the new subclasses in Baldur’s Gate 3 enhance role-playing opportunities, encouraging different interactions and story choices. The Warlock’s Hexblade, for example, allows for a pact with a Shadowfell entity that manifests through cursed weapons, changing how the character’s power is acquired and used. The Rogue’s Swashbuckler brings a more theatrical approach to combat, introducing duelist-style abilities that reward quick reflexes and agility.

Some subclasses introduce new mechanics entirely. The Monk’s Drunken Master recovers Ki by consuming alcohol, adding a layer of risk and reward to its playstyle—not to mention a bit of humor for those who find the game's drunk humor funny, such as the trophy for consuming alcohol at camp. The Sorcerer’s Shadow Magic subclass grants teleportation between dark areas and a spectral hound that weakens enemies. The Wizard’s Bladesinging subclass combines magic with melee combat, allowing spellcasters to fight up close while benefiting from speed and agility boosts.

For players who enjoy party synergy, the Ranger’s Swarmkeeper brings a tactical element with insect swarms that deal elemental damage or provide teleportation options. Whether optimizing a team or experimenting with different builds, the new subclasses encourage more strategic planning, and the potential for hilarious ways to destroy enemies.

Cross-Play and New Features Make a BG3 Restart Worthwhile

Patch 8 isn’t just about new subclasses. Cross-play support removes platform barriers, making it easier for friends to team up regardless of where they play.

Cross-play is particularly beneficial for those who enjoy cooperative campaigns but previously faced platform restrictions.

The addition of Photo Mode also provides new ways to engage with the game. Whether capturing action-packed battles or highlighting character moments, this feature enhances immersion. Combined with the expanded class options, these updates ensure that restarting Baldur’s Gate 3 in 2025 offers a fresh, engaging experience.

item.title: 8 Obsidian Entertainment Games With The Best Stories, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Obsidian's RPGs feature engaging writing & storylines, attracting fans back for more.
  • The Outer Worlds, Pillars of Eternity II, and South Park Stick of Truth offer unique, entertaining, & fun experiences.
  • Fallout: New Vegas remains a top RPG due to its iconic writing & gripping storyline with multiple ending possibilities.

The release of Avowed is right around the corner, with Obsidian Entertainment fans finding it unbearable to wait as they enjoy another adventure in the world of Eora. Despite some missteps, most players agree that Obsidian has treated fans to some of the greatest RPG experiences they can get their hands on.

As one would expect, the narrative and writing of each Obsidian Entertainment game play a huge role in ensuring that players enjoy a satisfactory experience. Thankfully, most games made by this developer feature riveting plotlines that will keep fans coming back for more.

8 The Outer Worlds

Some Elements Of The Plot May Be Surface-Level, But The Game Has Some Compelling Moments

While the social commentary present in The Outer Worlds is surface-level at best, that's just a small part of the overall experience. The zany writing and colorful visuals make The Outer Worlds devilishly entertaining despite its faults.

The plot has several engaging moments that fans adore as they head to different planets and witness the uniqueness of each location. It may not be the strongest Obsidian entry in terms of the story, but the hilarious writing and a suite of role-playing options ensure that fans will love coming back for more.

7 Pillars Of Eternity 2: Deadfire

Sailing The High Seas And Stopping Eothas From Breaking The Wheel Makes For A Great Time

Pillars of Eternity 2: Deadfire is an ambitious sequel that added a ton of seafaring to the journey that players could enjoy in this stellar CRPG. Players acquire a ship and embark on a grand adventure as they stop Eothas from destroying the Wheel and ending the cycle of rebirth.

It's a compelling quest where players make it a point to interact with different factions and figure out the optimal way to reach Eothas. The writing can be a bit too convoluted to justify every party member's fanatical obsession with their respective faction, but that's a small complaint in the grand scheme of things as players embark on an adventure for the ages.

6 South Park: The Stick Of Truth

The Authenticity Of The Plot Makes It Perfect For South Park Fans

South Park: The Stick of Truth is a game full of amazing writing as Trey Parker & Matt Stone contribute to the game's hilarious script. Players control a new kid who's roped into an epic quest where they must secure the Stick of Truth and prevent anyone from getting their hands on this "powerful" relic.

The story may get nonsensical at times, but that's precisely why it's so special for South Park fans. It's one of the most authentic video games that does justice to its IP and lets players feel like they're in a long and hilarious South Park episode.

5 Pillars Of Eternity

The Watcher's Adventures To Stop Thaos Is A Blast

From the moment players become a Watcher in Pillars of Eternity , they embark on a grand adventure as they're joined by multiple allies who aid them in their quest to uncover the truth behind the gods and stop the Hollowborn Crisis from plaguing the Dyrwood.

During this epic quest, they uncover several revelations and come face-to-face with Woedica's agent, Thaos ix Arkannon. The writing is impeccable from start to end, with the Kickstarter NPCs being the only puzzling addition to what is otherwise a tightly woven experience.

4 Tyranny

The Delicious Exploration Of Evil In This CRPG Is Something Fans Can't Get Enough Of

Players who want to check out a unique CRPG where being a hero isn't all that clear-cut will have a blast with Tyranny . Players work as a Fatebinder under Kyros' command who is playing a major role at the end of a brutal conquest, only for the flames of rebellion to be stoked in their hearts.

The Fatebinder and their allies will explore various locations as they acquire incredible powers and either choose to stand with or against Kyros. Either way, players will be treated to an amazing role-playing experience, and it's a shame that the game had to wrap things up with a hasty conclusion after becoming too ambitious for its own good.

3 Star Wars Knights Of The Old Republic 2: The Sith Lords

Features One Of The Best Stories Told In The Star Wars Universe

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic is one of the greatest RPGs of all time, and players had high hopes for its sequel. Unfortunately, Obsidian's inexperience meant that the game had to be rushed out with its fair share of bugs instead of achieving its true vision.

It's a shame since players who patched out the bugs realized just how incredible a sequel Knights of the Old Republic 2 is. Kreia quickly became one of the best Star Wars villains around as the protagonist's mentor questions the binary nature of the Force, a riveting angle that more pieces of Star Wars media should explore.

2 Pentiment

This Incredible Medieval Murder-Mystery Spans Generations And Is Riveting

One of the most unique RPGs of all time, Pentiment 's striking art style and the limited-time mechanic means that players can only explore so many avenues of investigation before they must name a culprit. This makes for a riveting gameplay loop as players go through the ages as Andreas Maler and solve numerous cases in the process.

The narrative of Pentiment can take some surprisingly emotional turns, with it being rife with religious themes coupled with the struggles people faced in medieval times. Depending on Andreas' chosen background, he can interact with NPCs in interesting ways and uncover the information he needs to find the answer villagers are craving.

1 Fallout: New Vegas

The Courier's Adventure Spirals Into An Epic Quest To Govern Who Controls New Vegas

Fallout: New Vegas is one of the greatest role-playing games ever made, with its writing playing a huge role in cementing its iconic stature. The Courier goes on a long and grueling journey to reach Benny and get his revenge, only to uncover a massive conspiracy revolving around the fate of New Vegas.

Depending on their choices, players can help Mr. House establish his supremacy, give the NCR the Platinum Chip to rule New Vegas, help Caesar's Legion carry out their barbaric actions, or take over New Vegas themselves. Each path is riveting, and it helps that the DLCs of New Vegas also boast some quality writing of their own.

item.title: Roblox: WWII Tycoon Codes (February 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All WWII Tycoon Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for WWII Tycoon
  • How to Get More WWII Tycoon Codes

WWII Tycoon is a business simulator with an unusual concept because here you can not only earn money but also capture the bases of other players. The game is based on a military theme, so you will invest all the income you receive in the defense of your base and the purchase of weapons for raiding your opponents.

In addition to reinvesting a constant income stream, another useful way to develop your base is to redeem WWII Tycoon codes. As in most other Roblox games, this is not difficult and time-consuming.

All WWII Tycoon Codes

Working WWII Tycoon Codes

  • BOOSTER - Redeem this code to get Mini-boost.

Expired WWII Tycoon Codes

There are currently no expired WWII Tycoon codes, so redeem active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

Redeeming WWII Tycoon codes will bring you a lot of useful rewards, such as temporary boosters. So, if you want to get at least a minimal advantage over other players, be sure to take advantage of this opportunity.

How to Redeem Codes for WWII Tycoon

As in most other Roblox games, the WWII Tycoon redemption option is hidden among the UI elements. To help you find and collect rewards quickly, follow this guide:

  • Launch WWII Tycoon .
  • Pay attention to the left side of the screen. There will be several buttons arranged in a column. Among them, interact with the last one with the wooden crate icon.
  • This will open a new menu. Here, at the bottom of the menu, you will find the redemption section, which contains an input field and a yellow Redeem button next to it. Now, enter one of the working codes from the list above into the input field.
  • Lastly, click on the yellow Redeem button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see a notification in the lower right corner of the screen with a list of rewards you have received. If it doesn't work, make sure you didn't make any mistakes when entering the code, or insert an extra space when copy-pasting.

How to Get More WWII Tycoon Codes

You can always visit this page to find the most recent WWII Tycoon codes. In addition, you can also visit the official pages of the game. Here, developers share new Roblox codes from time to time, usually with announcements or game updates.

  • Official WWII Tycoon Roblox group.
  • Official WWII Tycoon Guilded community.
  • Official WWII Tycoon Discord server.
